result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto E Galindo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Sarah H., Manuel D. or Walgreens.
DNA sample to be provided if not already done.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within 3 business days at the Waukesha Co. Sheriff's dept.
Case 14CF227 was dismissed and read into 14CF1052.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roberto E Galindo in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 3. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 3:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of surcharge.
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent and Doctor of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Sarah H. or Manuel D. or Walgreens.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 -  4 months jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) commencing 04/06/2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Last 60 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.   
Defendant to provide DNA sample,  immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Sentencing hearing on April 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defense requests another date for sentencing. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Jury status hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
